messages.message: Are you meant to run that outside of venv?
Ahh, okay. So it isn't tied to python in that case? I'm not aware of anything changing in gcloud. Can you try reconfiguring your authentication? Or does it work on other modules?

somehow when i do `make build-docker run-docker` while using `venv`, it returns that python error, but i thought the point of using docker is that you donâ€™t need to depend on anything locally? so i tried running the command outside of `venv` again and got the permission error

Since it's running docker through a makefile, there's no guarantee we don't do something python-related for that command. You'd have to look through the makefile to make sure (though it does seem pretty unlikely). Try building a different module outside of venv and see if you have the authentication issue. If you do, try running through the gcloud doc again?
Oh wait, for local it's here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1n402qewvICJiUoHenv7Oyv3Es0eW5hemf5plcHkCRao/edit#heading=h.bnleldrpo3nv
